trans-unit.source: Operational Insights Log Search API
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights Log Search API

trans-unit.source: Provides an overview of the Operational Insights Search API and includes examples that show you how to use it.
trans-unit.target: Provides an overview of the Operational Insights Search API and includes examples that show you how to use it.

trans-unit.source: This guide provides a basic tutorial describing how you can use the Operational Insights Log Search API and it provides examples that show you how to use the commands.
trans-unit.target: This guide provides a basic tutorial describing how you can use the Operational Insights Log Search API and it provides examples that show you how to use the commands.

trans-unit.source: The Operational Insights Log Search API is RESTful and can be accessed via the Azure Resource Manager API.
trans-unit.target: The Operational Insights Log Search API is RESTful and can be accessed via the Azure Resource Manager API.

trans-unit.source: In this document you will find examples where the API is accessed through the <linkText>ARMClient</linkText><title></title>, an open source command line tool that simplifies invoking the Azure Resource Manager API.
trans-unit.target: In this document you will find examples where the API is accessed through the <linkText>ARMClient</linkText><title></title>, an open source command line tool that simplifies invoking the Azure Resource Manager API.

trans-unit.source: The use of ARMClient and PowerShell is one of many options to access the Operational Insights Log Search API.
trans-unit.target: The use of ARMClient and PowerShell is one of many options to access the Operational Insights Log Search API.

trans-unit.source: With these tools you can utilize the RESTful Azure Resource Manager API to make calls to Operational Insights workspaces and perform search commands within them.
trans-unit.target: With these tools you can utilize the RESTful Azure Resource Manager API to make calls to Operational Insights workspaces and perform search commands within them.

trans-unit.source: The API will output search results to you in JSON format, allowing you to use the search results in many different ways programmatically.
trans-unit.target: The API will output search results to you in JSON format, allowing you to use the search results in many different ways programmatically.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Resource Manager can be used via a <linkText>Library for .NET</linkText><title></title> as well as a <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Resource Manager can be used via a <linkText>Library for .NET</linkText><title></title> as well as a <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Review the liked web pages to learn more.
trans-unit.target: Review the liked web pages to learn more.

trans-unit.source: Install <linkText>Chocolatey</linkText><title></title>, which is an an Open Source Machine Package Manager for Windows.
trans-unit.target: Install <linkText>Chocolatey</linkText><title></title>, which is an an Open Source Machine Package Manager for Windows.

trans-unit.source: Open a PowerShell window as administrator and then run the following command:
trans-unit.target: Open a PowerShell window as administrator and then run the following command:

trans-unit.source: Install the ARMClient by opening a new command prompt and run the following command:
trans-unit.target: Install the ARMClient by opening a new command prompt and run the following command:

trans-unit.source: Login to your Microsoft or OrgID account:
trans-unit.target: Login to your Microsoft or OrgID account:

trans-unit.source: The following examples show you how you can use the Search API.
trans-unit.target: The following examples show you how you can use the Search API.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the properties that are available.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the properties that are available.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: top
trans-unit.target: top

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of results to return.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of results to return.

trans-unit.source: highlight
trans-unit.target: highlight

trans-unit.source: Contains pre and post parameters, used usually for highlighting matching fields
trans-unit.target: Contains pre and post parameters, used usually for highlighting matching fields

trans-unit.source: pre
trans-unit.target: pre

trans-unit.source: Prefixes the given string to your matched fields.
trans-unit.target: Prefixes the given string to your matched fields.

trans-unit.source: post
trans-unit.target: post

trans-unit.source: Appends the given string to your matched fields.
trans-unit.target: Appends the given string to your matched fields.

trans-unit.source: query
trans-unit.target: query

trans-unit.source: The search query used to collect and return results.
trans-unit.target: The search query used to collect and return results.

trans-unit.source: start
trans-unit.target: start

trans-unit.source: The beginning of the time window you want results to be found from.
trans-unit.target: The beginning of the time window you want results to be found from.

trans-unit.source: end
trans-unit.target: end

trans-unit.source: The end of the time window you want results to be found from.
trans-unit.target: The end of the time window you want results to be found from.

trans-unit.source: Response:
trans-unit.target: Response:

trans-unit.source: Request the contents of a Saved Search:
trans-unit.target: Request the contents of a Saved Search:

trans-unit.source: If the search returns with a ‘Pending’ status, then polling the updated results can be done through this API.
trans-unit.target: If the search returns with a ‘Pending’ status, then polling the updated results can be done through this API.

trans-unit.source: After 6 min, the result of the search will be dropped from the cache and Http Gone will be returned.
trans-unit.target: After 6 min, the result of the search will be dropped from the cache and Http Gone will be returned.

trans-unit.source: If the initial search request returned a ‘Successful’ status immediately, it will not be added to the cache causing this API to return Http Gone if queried.
trans-unit.target: If the initial search request returned a ‘Successful’ status immediately, it will not be added to the cache causing this API to return Http Gone if queried.

trans-unit.source: The contents of an Http 200 result will be in the same format as the initial search request just with updated values.
trans-unit.target: The contents of an Http 200 result will be in the same format as the initial search request just with updated values.

trans-unit.target: Supported methods: GET PUT DELETE

trans-unit.target: Supported collection methods: GET

trans-unit.source: The Operational Insights Search API currently returns user-created saved searches when polled for saved searches in a workspace.
trans-unit.target: The Operational Insights Search API currently returns user-created saved searches when polled for saved searches in a workspace.

trans-unit.source: The API will not return saved searches provided by solutions at this time.
trans-unit.target: The API will not return saved searches provided by solutions at this time.

trans-unit.source: This functionality will be added at a later date.
trans-unit.target: This functionality will be added at a later date.

trans-unit.source: Here’s a way to see the fields for all log types for the data collected in your workspace.
trans-unit.target: Here’s a way to see the fields for all log types for the data collected in your workspace.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want you know if the Event type has a field named Computer, then this is one way to look up and confirm.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want you know if the Event type has a field named Computer, then this is one way to look up and confirm.

trans-unit.source: Request for Fields:
trans-unit.target: Request for Fields:

trans-unit.target: The following table describes the properties that are available.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: name
trans-unit.target: name

trans-unit.source: Field name.
trans-unit.target: Field name.

trans-unit.source: displayName
trans-unit.target: displayName

trans-unit.source: The display name of the field.
trans-unit.target: The display name of the field.

trans-unit.source: type
trans-unit.target: type

trans-unit.source: The Type of the field value.
trans-unit.target: The Type of the field value.

trans-unit.source: facetable
trans-unit.target: facetable

trans-unit.source: Combination of current ‘indexed’, ‘stored ‘and ‘facet’ properties.
trans-unit.target: Combination of current ‘indexed’, ‘stored ‘and ‘facet’ properties.

trans-unit.source: display
trans-unit.target: display

trans-unit.source: Current ‘display’ property.
trans-unit.target: Current ‘display’ property.

trans-unit.source: True if field is visible in search.
trans-unit.target: True if field is visible in search.

trans-unit.source: ownerType
trans-unit.target: ownerType

trans-unit.source: Reduced to only Types belonging to onboarded IP’s.
trans-unit.target: Reduced to only Types belonging to onboarded IP’s.

trans-unit.source: The following information describes optional parameters available.
trans-unit.target: The following information describes optional parameters available.

trans-unit.source: The “Highlight” parameter is an optional parameter you may use to request the search subsystem include a set of markers in its response.
trans-unit.target: The “Highlight” parameter is an optional parameter you may use to request the search subsystem include a set of markers in its response.

trans-unit.source: These markers indicate the start and end highlighted text that matches the terms provided in your search query.
trans-unit.target: These markers indicate the start and end highlighted text that matches the terms provided in your search query.

trans-unit.source: You may specify the start and end markers that will be used by search to wrap the highlighted term.
trans-unit.target: You may specify the start and end markers that will be used by search to wrap the highlighted term.
